description.narrative: Den föreslagna påfyllnaden av Zim-fonden om 20 MSEK kommer att bidra till att den avslutande delen av projektets fas 2 kommer att till en större del finansieras. Danmark fyller på fonden med ca 19 MUSD och Sverige i o m den föreslagna påfyllnaden ca 3 MUSD. AfDB/MMU har initialt föreslagit för Project Oversight Committee (POC) att använda tillgänglig finansiering till att fullfinansiera hela projektet avseende vatten & sanitet phase 2 (stage 1 och 2), och låta elektrifieringsprojektet agera dragspel där resterande medel (knappa 3 MUSD) används för prioriterade insatser inom EPIRP phase 2. Eventuella ytterligare givarmedel får då allokeras till EPIRP upp till den budgeterade nivån om 17,5 MUSD för den avslutande fas 2 av EPIRP. Slutligt beslut om fördelning av tillgängliga medel i fas 2 avses tas först vid fondens styrelsemöte (Project Oversight Committee, POC) i december 2014 och bekräftas i samband med AfDBs nästa styrelsemöte (ca februari 2015). Urgent Water Supply and Sanitation Rahabilitation Project (UWSSRP) phase 2 avser färdigställa påbörjade rehabiliteringsarbeten av vatten- och sanitetsanläggningar i Harare, Ruwa, Chitungwiza och Redcliff. Projektet inkluderar arbete för förändrade beteenden avseende hygien, kapacitetesbyggande (bla utarbetande av investeringsplaner, utbildning) samt projektadministration. Emergency Power Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project (EPIRP) phase 2 planerar med en begränsad finansiering arbeta med miljöåtgärder avseende Hwange Power Plant.
Multi-Donor Trust Fund administered by the African Development Bank for funding of projects for rehabilitation of water supply and sanitation services and the electric power sector.

UWSSRP:Impact objective: Improved quality of life. Outcome objective: 1. Improved availability of water supply in the project areas. 2. Raw sewage removed from residential areas and treatment capacity increased.3. Financial sustainability and performance of sector in the project areas improved. EPIRP:Impact objective: The power production capability of the installed capacity fully restored with due attention to environmental safety & protection. Outcome objective:1. Access to reliable electricity supply2. Improved environmental quality at Hwange Power Plant and surroundings.

description.narrative: During the reporting period, the project encountered a number of , which hindered smooth implementation and achievement of the ZimFund planned milestones: 1) The global and local lockdowns due to the outbreak of the Global COVID 19 pandemic delayed implementation and complete achievement of the planned programme milestones for the benefiting community members in Chitungwiza, Chegutu, Kwekwe, Masvingo, and Mutare urban Municipalities. 2) The impact of climate change that has been experienced in the country caused power supply challenges as well as lack of and limited access to clean and potable water. This also had negative impacts on public health in most communities, thus increased cases of diseases such as common Diarrhea and typhoid; 3) The social-economic environment in the country that was characterized by hyperinflation negatively impacted the performance of the ZimFund’s contractors. 4) Achievement of development results on EPIRP II could not be realized due to the poor performance of the contractor. Consequently, the ZimFund mandate that was to end in October 2020 had to be extended to December 2021 to allow for completion of the ZimFund’s Phase II Projects that have been adversely impacted by the global COVID 19 pandemic. Despite the above challenges, most of the Water, Consolidation Works Projects were completed and registered some notable results at outputs and outcome levels in all five benefiting municipalities. The ZimFund’s previous investments also continued to improve the lives of benefiting communities. For example by end of October 2020 over 2million people targeted (103%) were benefiting from the improved supply of water and sanitation, due to improvement of water infrastructure and capacities invested by ZimFund In 2020, the one-year defects liability period was satisfactorily completed for the Emergency Power Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project Phase II (EPIRP II) Stage I works project packages. The Bank’s Project Completion Report assessment ranked the project performance to be satisfactory, as it achieved most of the development objectives. Moreover, this grant has some saving of USD 440 136.80 from liquidated damages that have been retained for contingencies for the ongoing work contracts. The EPIRP II Stage II implementation that was expected to be completed by August 2020 continued but with a number of challenges such as COVID 19 pandemic and the poor performance of contractor that hindered timely completion. Activities under this phase has been moved to the next reporting period. The African Development Bank’s internal approval process for the rehabilitation of Outfall Sewers in Chitungwiza Project (additional financing III) is ongoing and expected to be done in February 2021. This followed the approval of the funds by the Project Oversight Committee (POC) which also directed that all future project savings and earnings from ZimFund investments will have to be channeled to Chitungwiza Sewer rehabilitation. This was done taking into account the degree of the dire situation of the water and sanitation delivery infrastructure in the municipality. By the end of September 2020, earnings on ZimFund account to the tune of USD1.787million were realized and in accordance with POC directives, this amount is being processed to fund Chitungwiza trunk sewers. While the Bank is processing the grant for funding the trunk sewers, the municipality assisted by the Procurement Agent and the Project Engineer are preparing the tender documents in readiness for the bidding process to start as soon as the Grant is approved.
